tags.title: Learning Objective
value: Explain changes and continuities in systems of slavery in the period from 1450 to 1750.
Explain the continuities and changes in economic systems and labor systems from 1450 to 1750.

tags.title: Thematic Focus
value: The process by which societies group their members, and the norms that govern the interactions between these groups and between individuals, influence political, economic, and cultural institutions and organization.
As societies develop, they affect and are affected by the ways that they produce, exchange, and consume goods and services.

tags.title: Historical Development
value: The growth of the plantation economy increased the demand for enslaved people in the Americas, leading to significant demographic, social, and cultural changes.

Newly developed colonial economies in the Americas largely depended on agriculture, utilized existing labor systems, including the Incan mit'a, and introduced new labor systems, including chattel slavery, indentured servitude, encomienda and hacienda syst

tags.title: Stimulus Title
tags.value: NUMBER OF AFRICANS TRANSPORTED TO BRITISH NORTH AMERICA AS SLAVES
